pkgmetadata.longdescription:
The Android Native Development Kit (NDK) contains the prebuilt toolchain, and prebuilt set of native libraries (with headers), and build system tools.
The implementation of the standard C libraries (libc, libm), the deprecated system c++ library (libstdc++) and linker library (libdl) collectively under the Boinic which is included in the NDK for purposes of building and linking. The libc++ is the full llvm project implmentation. The system c++ library is reduced to new and delete. See the stable_apis link in the docs section link for details.
Filenames of native libraries per API level:
crtbegin_dynamic.o crtbegin_so.o crtbegin_static.o crtend_android.o crtend_so.o libEGL.so libGLESv1_CM.so libGLESv2.so libGLESv3.so libOpenMAXAL.so libOpenSLES.so libaaudio.so libamidi.so libandroid.so libbinder_ndk.so libc++.a libc++.so libc.so libcamera2ndk.so libdl.so libicu.so libjnigraphics.so liblog.so libm.so libmediandk.so libnativehelper.so libnativewindow.so libneuralnetworks.so libstdc++.so libsync.so libvulkan.so libz.so
* This list may vary per API level.
If the library is listed here, no effort is required to manually port that ebuild-package to the device. No effort is required to build the compiler for the device.
Toolchain support:
NDK 25: armv7a, aarch64, i686, x86_64; python 3.9 (internal); clang 14.0.6 (internal)
API level support
NDK 25: 19 - 33
For API level to Android version correspondance, see
https://source.android.com/docs/setup/start/build-numbers
Long Term Support (LTS) policy:
https://github.com/android/ndk/wiki
